p: To evaluate the antidiarrheal activity of (-)-fenchone the castor oil-induced diarrhea model was used in mice. Castor oil is a natural product obtained from the seeds of Ricinus communis, that when ingested is metabolized by intestinal lipases, releasing ricinoleic acid in the intestinal lumen, creating extensive contractions in the transverse and distal colon[ 43]. This substance causes a reduction in Na +, K-ATPase activity, inhibition of sodium, chloride, and water absorption, increased contractions of smooth intestine muscles, produces a cytotoxic effect on enterocytes, resulting in abundant watery diarrhea with an accumulation of intestinal fluid[ 44].
